title: How Netflix Uses AI for Content Recommendations
summary: Netflix's recommendation engine demonstrates real-world supervised learning at scale, saving the company over $1 billion annually through personalisation.
content:
Case Study: Netflix Recommendation Engine

Netflix serves over 230 million subscribers globally. With a library of thousands of titles, the challenge is not availability — it is discovery. Netflix's recommendation system ensures that 80% of what users watch is discovered through recommendations, not search.

The AI Approach

Netflix uses a multi-stage recommendation pipeline combining collaborative filtering, content-based filtering, and deep learning models. Collaborative filtering identifies users with similar taste profiles. Content-based models analyse metadata, subtitles, and visual features of titles.

Business Impact

The recommendation engine contributes to subscriber retention worth over $1 billion per year. Without it, subscribers would spend more time browsing and less time watching, increasing churn risk.

Key Learning

Supervised learning and recommendation systems are not abstract mathematics — they are the invisible hand guiding what billions of people watch every evening.
